citation.article-title: Nucleic acid studies on some heterofermentative lactobacilli: description of Lactobacillus malefermentans sp. nov. and Lactobacillus parabuchneri sp. nov.

p.s: Cells are rod-shaped (0.8-1.0 × 1.5-2.5 μm), occurring singly, in pairs or chains. Cells and Gram-positive and non-motile; grow at 15 and 30°C; some strains grow at 10°C but not at 37°C; facultatively anaerobic; catalase negative; heterofermentative; gas is produced from glucose; acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, D-glucose, maltose, α-methyl-D-glucoside and ribose. Some strains produce acid from gluconate. Acid is not produced from adonitol, amidon, amygdaline, o-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, fructose, D-fucose, L-fucose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, glycerol, glycogen, 2-keto-gluconate, 5-keto-gluconate, inositol, inulin, lactose, D-lyxose, D-mannose, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, β-methylxyloside, α-methyl-D-mannoside, D-raffinose, rhamnose, salicin, L-sorbose, sorbitol, sucrose, D-tagatose, D-turanose, trehalose, D-xylose, L-xylose and xylitol; aesculin and gelatin are not hydrolysed; arginine dihydrolase positive; urease and H2S are not produced; nitrate is not reduced to nitrite; Voges-Proskauer negative; the mol% G + C content of DNA ranges from 41 to 42; isolated from beer; the type strain is NCDO 1410. The description of the type strain corresponds with that of the species except acid is produced from gluconate.
